p: HIV, a global public health problem for nearly four decades, has affected almost 80 million globally, with nearly half of them dying from AIDS-related diseases. In 2019, nearly 25 million people were living with HIV in Sub-Saharan Africa (SSA), the region with the highest number of HIV cases [ 1]. Rwanda faces a generalized HIV epidemic, and as of 2019, 230,000 people were living with HIV (PLWH) in Rwanda [ 2]. In the midst of a global and local effort to control the HIV epidemic, a novel coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic has emerged. The diseases caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-COV 2) has over 32 million cases and 980,000 deaths globally as of 25th September 2020 [ 3]. As of 25th September 2020, 4798 cases and 29 COVID-19 related deaths have been reported in Rwanda [ 4].
